revised_title: Biological Implications of Fronts on the Northwest European Continental Shelf
tldr: This article discusses the biological implications of three types of frontal systems - tidal, coastal, and shelf-break - on the northwest European continental shelf. These fronts are characterized by high standing crops of phytoplankton and act as biogeographic boundaries between water masses with distinct plankton communities. The article examines the physical factors that affect these fronts and their impact on biological productivity in the region.
